metadata.name: Root Certificate Installed From Susp Locations
metadata.comment: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('import-certificate')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -filepath ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('cert:\\localmachine\\root')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\appdata\\local\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\windows\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\desktop\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\downloads\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\perflogs\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\users\\public\\'))))

output.summary: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
